issue.title: [CF 474] Possible Compatability Issue with ClassColors Mod
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Update to TellMeWhen 5.0.2
2. Use ClassColors 4.2.0.51 alongside.
3. Log in.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
I expect both mods to run alongside one another with no issue, which they seem to since I don't use any class coloring in my icon set-ups. However, I still get the error below upon logging in.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
5.0.2

Do you have an error log of what happened?

5x !ClassColors-4.2.0.51\ClassColors.lua:50: Bad argument #1 to :RegisterCallback (string or function expected)
<in C code>
!ClassColors-4.2.0.51\ClassColors.lua:50: in function "RegisterCallback"
TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen-r492.lua:3111: in function <TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:3060>
(tail call): ?
<in C code>
<string>:"safecall Dispatcher[1]":9: in function <string>:"safecall Dispatcher[1]":5
(tail call): ?
Ace3-r1048\AceAddon-3.0\AceAddon-3.0-11.lua:514: in function "InitializeAddon"
Ace3-r1048\AceAddon-3.0\AceAddon-3.0-11.lua:629: in function <Ace3\AceAddon-3.0\AceAddon-3.0.lua:621>

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)


> Posted by CurseForge user Decabah | Imported from CurseForge issue #474 | Raw

comments.body:
Attachment Added: TellMeWhen.lua

TellMeWhen.lua

<p>TellMeWhen saved variables.</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user Decabah

Should be fixed in r493.

http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/files/755-r493/


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

No error upon logging in after the update. Thanks a bunch!


> Posted by CurseForge user Decabah
